page.title: 17WATER LANE ALLOTMENTS
page.content: About two miles from our school there are some allotments. They were opened in 1922. There are one hundred and thirty nine plots either five or ten rod (one rod equals three square yards). To have an allotment costs 5Op. per rod and most people have five or ten rods, but a few people have more than one plot. You are allowed 1 shed on the plot and it must be twenty square feet floor area. To get a plot you need to apply to the council. Most people grow vegetables on their plot but you can grow flowers. There are very few overgrown plots because if you do leave your plot to run wild then the council will reclaim it. Most people walk to the allotments and live within half a mile. Most of the allotment holders are retired people who visit the allotments almost every day in summer.
